originalText.text: Heat watch installs sensors in the warmest apts and all others freeze...we are two senior citizens and our bedroom averages 50 degrees in winter....when you tell the super his response is‚ÄùI have no control over the boiler‚Äù....ever since heateatch has had control of the boiler ....we freeze every winter

originalText.text:
I live in a building at 145 2nd avenue and Citi Urban Management who owns the building has hired Heat Watch.  I've come to learn that Heat Watch sets our heat to go on only when the temperature goes BELOW 50 degrees during the day and BELOW 40 degrees at night.  This is completely illegal in New York which requires that if the outside temperature goes below 55 degrees then inside the apartments should be 68 degrees, at night 62 degrees.  We have not had any heat in the past two weeks even though temperatures have gone below 55 degrees outside many times.

when you try and call Heat Watch every 'mailbox' is full.  This is clearly a company that Landlords are calling on to keep tenants in the cold in order to save money---even if they are breaking with legal requirements.

If you are cold----they will keep it that way as they have installed a computer to buildings boiler systems to make sure it stays that way.

Slumlord tactics.  Report them to the city.
